description: Leon Edwards says his chance to reclaim the UFC welterweight title will happen next if he can win his fight against Sean Brady at UFC London.
title: UFC London: Leon Edwards says a win over Sean Brady will secure title shot
title_page: UFC London: Leon Edwards says a win over Sean Brady will secure title shot - BBC Sport
maintext:
Leon Edwards says his fight with American Sean Brady at UFC London will decide the next welterweight world title contender.
The Briton fights on 22 March for the first time since losing the UFC belt to Belal Muhammad last July.
Edwards, 33, was booked to fight Jack Della Maddalena, but the Australian was pulled from the card to face Muhammad instead on 10 May.
"If Jack goes out and gets a win, it'll open up the division more, that'll be the perfect fight for me next," Edwards said on his YouTube channel., external
"If Belal beats him, then the rematch is there as well. I've talked to the UFC, and they've said that this [bout] is a number one contender fight.
"When I win this, I fight for the title."
Edwards said he offered to step in for the injured Shavkat Rakhmonov against Muhammad, but the UFC did not want to pull him from the London card.
"It would be weird to let Jack headline London," he added.
Edwards headlines UFC London, with Liverpool star Molly McCann also in action.
